comments.author: PX-Z

comments.body: Most people here know what kind of service 1xbit have, their shitty casino and their previous scams[1]. But at least explain yourself what actually happened, what are you trying to do, what step have you made already before posting here.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5343377.0

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: I agree, you should explain a bit better your case. The image pinned in your link is not very enlightening by itself, it is in Italian, and you are forcing forum members to visit an external page, which is not the best practice.Just in order to avoid the inconvenience, the pinned picture is the following one:BTW, did you read the T&A or tried to contact their Customer Service?Again, if you want help, set forth your case.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Porfirii on August 03, 2022, 08:30:31 PMI agree, you should explain a bit better your case.While OP indeed didn't really explain his problem, it's a known one: there are many users whose winning were not paid by that casino, just look for the feedbacks, flags and complains already existing.Still, unfortunately people come to write onto bitcointalk only after they've god scammed. And they don't read the feedback already existing here.And, from what I've heard, the casino has filled the internet with (fake?) positive reviews, so their real face is basically visible only here.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Consider the numbers of threads on reputation that talks about the scam in the daid campaign and how there have been warning to stay off the campaign expect at wish and interest, f you apply to a campaign that has been raised on red flag like this before now then know that you're at your risk, that's why for the newbies that just come up onboard to the forum need time to read, study and know what's going on with the forum activities and get familiar before engaging on anything they might regret doing later.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Look, another one has been victimized by 1xbit. These guys are no longer proactively making their moves in the cryptospace, yet people still falls for their scam platform thinking that the guys at 1xbit already changed. A quick google search with the words "1xbit scam" would lead you to a lot of discussions describing how these guys are scamming people off their money without even doing anything. Even if you are not a bitcointalk member, you should see that 1xbit reviews from other people are mostly negative. I'm sorry but you'll never see your money ever again.

comments.author: edgycorner
comments.body: Even google snippet calls it a scam now lolAll you had to do was google before making any deposit. If you can't even screen a site before giving them your money, then you kind of deserve it along with a Darwin award  Play stupid games, win stupid prizes.

comments.author: Zackgeno96
comments.body: Screenshot is very very common. You can't see anything on it. If you have a complaint about a casino, you must substantiate it and also come up with better evidence. 1xbit has already paid a lot of players and is a very big player in the gambling industry with a huge budget. If people play fair, these will all be paid out. On the screenshot we can really see far too little to make a judgment about it. Also, you posted this in the wrong topic.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Gambler here in the forum already know the shady work of 1xBit, I’m sure there’s no need to remind us here but the problem is those who are outside this forum who still fall for this trap and if you are a victim OP, I guess you failed to do your own research.I’m wondering if those gamblers done their research before trying the site because if they do, most probably they will see a lot of articles about this site being a scam.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Quote from: edgycorner on August 03, 2022, 08:52:30 PMPlay stupid games, win stupid prizes.I've always wondered why people try to get into collapsing schemes. It's always like that. Years ago when there were many cloud mining scams and there were threads all over the forum, every week you'd get someone asking if it's a good idea to put money in this or that site and all they needed to do is search the forum or google it. They were too lazy for it, but they weren't too lazy to make an account on a shady site promising 10% a month and send them their hard earned money. So I'll ask again. Why do you keep playing in shady casinos when there's so many legit ones. Your chances of wining at a legit one are probably 40% or less, why lower it to 0 by trusting scammers?

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Funexchange on August 03, 2022, 08:00:46 PM1xbit don't pay!!!!!I see that you are already a member here in the forum since 2020, and from that time many already knew that 1xbit is a scam, wondering why you are still playing on that site until this moment? This has been discussed here for many times, yet many people still fall for this scam site. If only there's a way to ban those 1xbit participants probably that's the best way to prevent any victim here but again, this forum is as good source of information, and if you are looking for more victims of this scam site, you can easily search it here. Don't fall for any shady site especially in gambling because its not worth it at all.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: It's your responsibility to carry out research about a casino before using it. 1xbit has so many scam accusation in the forum and outside the forum. I wonder how you missed out seeing any of them… or perhaps you ignored the warnings. But sorry about your money getting scammed.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: Funexchange on August 03, 2022, 08:00:46 PM1xbit don't pay!!!!!I'm sorry, I don't know how far you lost money and how much money you deposited in this casino scam. but before I comment on that, you need to post proof, this casino is known by all members of this forum that they are scam, but even these scammers have some right unfortunately and that right is that you cannot accuse them without proof, accuse to them without proof it would be slander and defamation, so for your case if you want us to believe you you have to post evidence, and it has to be valid proof, not evidence that you played and lostthen I have the following question:Did you do research before making a deposit at this casino?what game were you playing at this casino?Quote from: logfiles on August 03, 2022, 09:44:51 PMIt's your responsibility to carry out research about a casino before using it. 1xbit has so many scam accusation in the forum and outside the forum.it is very strange that there are still people who create an account and make deposits at this casino, because on the internet there are so many accusations about them that anyone will soon see

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: You gamble on that site without doing any research, then that is the result of being too careless.This is a lesson to you OP that before trying any site, you should do your research first especially know the reviews about that site. Though its not ok to see another victim of this site, is there any chance to help those newbies who are still interested to this site? I think having this kind of accusation and topics about this scam site is not enough.

comments.author: rby
comments.body: Quote from: dothebeats on August 03, 2022, 08:45:33 PMLook, another one has been victimized by 1xbit. These guys are no longer proactively making their moves in the cryptospace, yet people still falls for their scam platform thinking that the guys at 1xbit already changed. A quick google search with the words "1xbit scam" would lead you to a lot of discussions describing how these guys are scamming people off their money without even doing anything. Even if you are not a bitcointalk member, you should see that 1xbit reviews from other people are mostly negative. I'm sorry but you'll never see your money ever again.You are a Legendary member and have been in this forum for long and you know the activities of 1xbit. You cannot bet with them. Anyone who is a gambler and arrives in this forum should know that 1xbit is a scam casino. That is why you see most times it is newbies or newbie accounts that are always victims of this scams.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on August 03, 2022, 09:44:51 PMIt's your responsibility to carry out research about a casino before using it. 1xbit has so many scam accusations in the forum and outside the forum. I wonder how you missed out on seeing any of them… or perhaps you ignored the warnings. But sorry about your money getting scammed.I don't know why many users still fall to this scam, I concluded lately that the reason why we keep seeing more and more cases of scams against this casino is that the new players are too lazy to go through the reviews of others and also checking to see what the forum members stands are on a casino before going ahead to make a deposit, in the last one year and beyond this forum have been flooded with loads of complaints about this casino already. So it shouldn't be a big deal to discover what the mode of operations are, their deny and lock account when there is big winning, and the cases that are been reported here follow similar patterns

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.created_time: August 03, 2022, 10:04:34 PMLast edit: August 03, 2022, 11:02:21 PM by CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Zackgeno96 on August 03, 2022, 09:09:21 PM If you have a complaint about a casino, you must substantiate it and also come up with better evidence. 1xbit has already paid a lot of players and is a very big player in the gambling industry with a huge budget. If people play fair, these will all be paid out. And 1xbit has also banned alot of accounts after winning, which you can see alot of accusations on the "Scam Accusations" section of forum. But that you are running a signature campaign for a casino doesn't mean you shouldn't say the truth when you see it, because 1xbet is one casino I have known tagged to be a scam both in and outside the forum with bunch of unresolved scam accusations. Because most of the common issues I have got people complain about 1xbet is banning of an accounts after winning, which is literally unfair..And here is a proof of one of 1xbit complainthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5267433.0

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Let me guess, you didn't research more about 1xbit and its reputation right?. 1xbit does have bad reputation in this forum which one of then is not paying their gamblers when they requested a cash out or withdrawal. I don't know why there's still people who fall for this scam gambling site. The lesson learnt in this situation is that you should made some research if the site you want to gamble is legit and have good reputation. Don't trust review sites easily as some of the review site's review about the gambling site is biased or they are paid to give good review.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Wiwo on August 03, 2022, 09:58:59 PMQuote from: logfiles on August 03, 2022, 09:44:51 PMIt's your responsibility to carry out research about a casino before using it. 1xbit has so many scam accusations in the forum and outside the forum. I wonder how you missed out on seeing any of them… or perhaps you ignored the warnings. But sorry about your money getting scammed.I don't know why many users still fall to this scam, I concluded lately that the reason why we keep seeing more and more cases of scams against this casino is that the new players are too lazy to go through the reviews of others and also checking to see what the forum members stands are on a casino before going ahead to make a deposit, in the last one year and beyond this forum have been flooded with loads of complaints about this casino already.That could be a reason in many cases but we also need to be aware that in selective scams like 1xBit, they depend significatively on shilling and marketing for them to continue attracting victims. It is a battle between information and desinformation.For example, they use legitimate services and webpages to advertise themselves, here is a thread about how they parasited trust people have in the hot wallet mycelium, to advertise themselves.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5350964.0Some unknowing victims might think that "If mycelium promotes it, must be legit", and only with that (false) assumption they jump onto the webpage with no previous research and this happens in a variety of ways: influencers, youtubers, pay review articles, signature campaigns, promotions... they even tried to censor places on the internet that pointed them out as scammers.So yes, it is responsability of the user to be informed and do their own research but 1xBit also moves mountains to keep the victims coming.
